intro: Jonthlaspi elegans, commonly known as the slender whitlow grass, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It typically forms dense mats of foliage and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It is adapted to cold climates and can thrive in poor, rocky soils. Jonthlaspi elegans is often found in tundra and mountainous habitats where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
